data_fields.name: agricultureStructureIndicator
data_fields.title: Agriculture Structure Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates whether a building is reported as being an agricultural structure in the policy application. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'.

data_fields.name: asOfDate
data_fields.title: As of Date
data_fields.description: The effective date of the data in the file. When time is not specified in the field, it will default to T00:00:00.000Z

data_fields.name: basementEnclosureCrawlspaceType
data_fields.title: Basement Enclosure Crawlspace Type
data_fields.description: Basement is defined for purposes of the NFIP as any level or story which has its floor subgrade on all sides.

data_fields.name: policyCount
data_fields.title: Policy Count
data_fields.description: Insured units in an active status. A policy contract ceases to be in an active status as of the cancellation date or the expiration date. Residential Condominium Building Association Policy (RCBAP) contracts are stored as a single policy contract but insure multiple units and therefore represent multiple policies

data_fields.name: crsClassificationCode
data_fields.title: CRS Classification Code
data_fields.description: The Community Rating System (CRS) Classification Credit Percentage used to rate the policy. The insurance premium credit is based on whether a property is in or out of the Special Flood Hazard Area (SFHA) as shown on the community's Flood Insurance Rate Map. The premium credit for properties in the SFHA increases according to a community's CRS class.

data_fields.name: dateOfLoss
data_fields.title: Date of Loss
data_fields.description: Date on which water first entered the insured building. When time is not specified in the field, it will default to T00:00:00.000Z

data_fields.name: elevatedBuildingIndicator
data_fields.title: Elevated Building Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates whether a building meets the NFIP definition of an elevated building. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. An elevated building is a no-basement building that was constructed so as to meet the following criteria: 1. The top of the elevated floor (all A zones) or the bottom of the lowest horizontal structural member of the lowest floor (all V zones) is above ground level. 2. The building is adequately anchored. 3. The method of elevation is pilings, columns (posts and piers), shear walls (not in V zones), or solid foundation perimeter walls (not in V zones).

data_fields.name: elevationCertificateIndicator
data_fields.title: Elevation Certificate Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates if a policy has been rated with Elevation Certificate. (An empty value indicates that this information was not reported; it does not necessarily mean that these properties do not have an Elevation Certificate, just that one was not reported at the time the policy was written.)

codes.1: No Elevation Certificate, original effective date prior to October 1, 1982, with no break in insurance coverage or change in insurable interest. Policies will be rated using No Base Flood Elevation +2 to +4 feet rates
codes.2: No Elevation Certificate, original effective date on or after October 1, 1982, with no break in insurance coverage or change in insurable interest. Policies will be rated using No Elevation Certificate rates
codes.3: Elevation Certificate with BFE. Policies will be rated using With Base Flood Elevation rates
codes.4: Elevation Certificate without BFE. Policies will be rated using No Base Flood Elevation rates
codes.C: Piles, Piers, or Columns with Enclosure
codes.D: Piles, Piers, or Columns without Enclosure

data_fields.name: elevationDifference
data_fields.title: Elevation Difference
data_fields.description: Difference between the elevation of the lowest floor used for rating, or the floodproofed elevation, and the base flood elevation (BFE), or base flood depth, as appropriate. Round to nearest higher elevation difference in whole feet using .5 as the midpoint NOTE: The depth shown on the Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM) for Zone AO that indicates the depth of water above the highest adjacent grade resulting from a flood that has a 1% chance of equaling or exceeding that level in any given year.The elevation of surface water resulting from a flood that has a 1% chance of equaling or exceeding that level in any given year. The BFE is shown on the FloodInsurance Rate Map (FIRM) forZones AE, AH, A1-A30, AR, AR/A, AR/AE, AR/A1-A30, AR/AH, AR/A0, V1-V30 andVE. The value of 9999.0 indicates the field is not reported and/or used for this policy

data_fields.name: baseFloodElevation
data_fields.title: Base Flood Elevation
data_fields.description: Base Flood Elevation (BFE) is the elevation in feet from the Elevation Certificate at which there is a 1% chance per year of flooding.

data_fields.name: ratedFloodZone
data_fields.title: Rated Flood Zone
data_fields.description: NFIP Flood Zone derived from the Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM) used to rate the insured property.

codes.A: Special Flood with no Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.AE: Special Flood with Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.X: Moderate Flood from primary water source. Pockets of areas subject to drainage problems
codes.B: Moderate Flood from primary water source. Pockets of areas subject to drainage problems
codes.C: Minimal Flood from primary water source. Pockets of areas subject to drainage problems
codes.V: Velocity Flood with no Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.VE: Velocity Flood with Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.AR: A Special Flood Hazard Area that results from the decertification of a previously accredited flood protection system that is determined to be in the process of being restored to provide base flood protection
codes.AR/AE: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/A1-A30: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/AH: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/AO: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/A: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone

data_fields.name: houseWorship
data_fields.title: House of Worship
data_fields.description: Indicates whether a building is reported as being a house of worship in the policy application. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'.

data_fields.name: locationOfContents
data_fields.title: Location of Contents
data_fields.description: Code that indicates the location of contents.

codes.3: Lowest floor only above ground level (no basement/enclosure/crawlspace/subgrade crawlspace)
codes.4: Lowest floor above ground level and higher floors (no basement/enclosure/crawlspace/subgrade crawlspace)
codes.5: Above ground level more than one full floor
codes.6: Manufactured (mobile) home or travel trailer on foundation

data_fields.name: lowestAdjacentGrade
data_fields.title: Lowest Adjacent Grade
data_fields.description: Lowest natural grade adjacent to the insured structure prior to excavating or filling. The difference in feet of the lowest natural grade adjacent to the building from the reference level of the building

data_fields.name: lowestFloorElevation
data_fields.title: Lowest Floor Elevation
data_fields.description: A building's lowest floor is the floor or level (including basement/enclosure/crawlspace/subgrade crawlspace) that is used as the point of reference when rating a building. This includes the level to which a building is floodproofed. The elevation in feet of the reference level of the building from the Elevation Certificate.

data_fields.name: numberOfFloorsInTheInsuredBuilding
data_fields.title: Number of Floors in the Insured Building
data_fields.description: Code that indicates the number of floors in the insured building.

codes.5: Manufactured (mobile) home or travel trailer on foundation
codes.6: Townhouse/Rowhouse with three or more floors (RCBAP Low-rise only)

data_fields.name: nonProfitIndicator
data_fields.title: Non-Profit Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates whether a building is reported as being a non-profit in the policy application. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'.

data_fields.name: obstructionType
data_fields.title: Obstruction Type
data_fields.description: Code that describes the type of obstruction that may be present under an elevated building. An obstruction includes an enclosed area and/or machinery and equipment attached to the building below the lowest elevated floor.

codes.15: With obstruction: enclosure/crawlspace with proper openings not used for rating (not applicable in V Zones)
codes.20: With obstruction: less than 300 sq. ft. with breakaway walls, but no machinery or equipment attached to building below lowest elevated floor, or the elevation of the machinery or equipment is at or above the Base Flood Elevation
codes.24: With obstruction: less than 300 sq. ft. with breakaway walls or finished enclosure and with machinery or equipment attached to building below lowest elevated floor. The elevation of the machinery or equipment is below the Base Flood Elevation.
codes.30: With obstruction: 300 sq. ft. or more with breakaway walls, but no machinery or equipment attached to building below the Base Flood Elevation
codes.34: With obstruction: 300 sq. ft. or more with breakaway walls or finished enclosure and with machinery or equipment attached to building below the Base Flood Elevation
codes.40: With obstruction: no walls, but the elevation of machinery or equipment attached to building is below Base Flood Elevation
codes.50: With obstruction: nonbreakawaywalls/crawlspace or finished enclosure with no machinery or equipment attached to building below lowest elevated floor
codes.54: With obstruction: nonbreakawaywalls/crawlspace or finished enclosure with machinery or equipment attached to building below lowest elevated floor
codes.70: With Certification subgrade crawlspace (AE, A01-A30, unnumbered A, AO, AH,AOB, AHB zones)
codes.90: With Enclosure: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in A zones. No other enclosure below the BFE.
codes.91: Free of Obstruction: Elevated buildings with lattice, slats, or shutters (including louvers) enclosing the elevator below the BFE in V zones. No other obstruction or machinery and equipment (M&E) servicing the building located below the BFE. The building will be rated free of obstruction with the V zone elevator loading added to the building basic limit.
codes.92: With Enclosure: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in A zones. Enclosure below the BFE has no proper openings, is finished, or is used for other than parking, building access,or storage.
codes.94: With Obstruction: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in V zones. No other obstruction or machinery and equipment (M&E)servicing the building located belowthe BFE.
codes.95: With Obstruction: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in V zones. Breakaway wall obstruction is unfinished and elevator and obstruction are located below the BFE but no machinery and equipment (M&E) servicing the building is located below the BFE.
codes.96: With Obstruction: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in V zones. Breakaway wall obstruction is finished or is used for other than parking, building access, or storage.
codes.97: With Obstruction: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in V zones. No other obstruction, but has M&E servicing the building located below the BFE.
codes.98: With Obstruction: Elevated buildings with elevator below the BFE in V zones. Breakaway walls obstruction and M&E servicing the building are located below the BFE.

data_fields.name: occupancyType
data_fields.title: Occupancy Type
data_fields.description: Code indicating the use and occupancy type of the insured structure. Note, 2-digit codes are for Risk Rating 2.0 policies.

codes.3: residential building with more than 4 units
codes.11: Single-family residential building with the exception of a mobile home or a single residential unit within a multi unit building
codes.12: A residential non-condo building with 2, 3, or 4 units seeking insurance on all units
codes.13: A residential non-condo building with 5 or more units seeking insurance on all units
codes.15: Residential condo association seeking coverage on a building with one or more units
codes.16: Single residential unit within a multi-unit building
codes.19: a non-residential unit within a multi-unit building

data_fields.name: originalConstructionDate
data_fields.title: Original Construction Date
data_fields.description: The original date of the construction of the building.

data_fields.name: originalNBDate
data_fields.title: Original NB Date
data_fields.description: The original date of the flood policy.

data_fields.name: amountPaidOnBuildingClaim
data_fields.title: Amount Paid on Building Claim
data_fields.description: Dollar amount paid on the building claim. In some instances, a negative amount may appear which occurs when a check issued to a policy holder is not cashed and has to be re-issued

data_fields.name: amountPaidOnContentsClaim
data_fields.title: Amount Paid on Contents Claim
data_fields.description: Dollar amount paid on the contents claim. In some instances, a negative amount may appear, which occurs when a check issued to a policy holder is not cashed and has to be re-issued

data_fields.name: amountPaidOnIncreasedCostOfComplianceClaim
data_fields.title: Amount Paid on Increased Cost of Compliance (ICC) Claim
data_fields.description: ICC coverage is one of several flood insurance resources for policyholders who need additional help rebuilding after a flood. It provides up to $30,000 to help cover the cost of mitigation measures that will reduce the flood risk

data_fields.name: postFIRMConstructionIndicator
data_fields.title: Post-FIRM Construction Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates whether construction was started before or after publication of the FIRM. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. For insurance rating purposes, buildings for which the start of construction or substantial improvement was after December 31, 1974, or on or after the effective date of the initial FIRM for the community, whichever is later, are considered Post-FIRM construction.

data_fields.name: rateMethod
data_fields.title: Rate Method
data_fields.description: Indicates policy rating method.

codes.7: Preferred Risk Policy (PRPs issued for eligible properties located within a non-Special Flood Hazard Area [non-SFHA])
codes.B: Pre-FIRM policies with elevation rating - Flood Insurance Manual rate tables
codes.P: Preferred Risk Policy (A PRP renewal issued in the first year following a map revision for an eligible property that was newly mapped into the SFHA by the map revision, or new business written for an eligible property that was newly mapped into the SFHA by a map revision effective on or after October 1, 2008 - PRP Eligibility Extension)
codes.Q: Preferred Risk Policy (subsequent PRP renewals where the previous policy year was reported as a 'P' or 'Q')
codes.T: Severe Repetitive Loss Properties (formerly Target Group Full Risk). Effective October 1, 2013, code will no longer be valid
codes.W: Pre-FIRM policies with elevation rating - Submit-for-Rate procedures
codes.RatingEngine: Risk Rated policies where FEMA calculates the rates based on various risk factors.

data_fields.name: smallBusinessIndicatorBuilding
data_fields.title: Small Business Indicator Building
data_fields.description: Indicates whether or not the insured represents a small business. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. Small business is defined as a business with fewer than 100 employees in the policy application.

data_fields.name: totalBuildingInsuranceCoverage
data_fields.title: Total Building Insurance Coverage
data_fields.description: Total Insurance Amount in whole dollars on the Building

data_fields.name: totalContentsInsuranceCoverage
data_fields.title: Total Contents Insurance Coverage
data_fields.description: Total Insurance Amount in whole dollars on the Contents

data_fields.name: yearOfLoss
data_fields.title: Year of Loss
data_fields.description: Year in which the flood loss occurred

data_fields.name: primaryResidenceIndicator
data_fields.title: Primary Residence Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates whether a building is a primary residence. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. A primary residence is a single family building, condominium unit, apartment unit, or unit within a cooperative building that will be lived in by the policyholder or the policyholder's spouse for: More than 50% of the 365 calendar days following the current policy effective date; or 50% or less of the 365 calendar days following the current policy effective date if the policyholder has only one residence and does not lease that residence to another party or use it as rental or income property at any time during the policy term. A policyholder and the policyholder's spouse may not collectively have more than one primary residence

data_fields.name: buildingDamageAmount
data_fields.title: Building Damage Amount
data_fields.description: The actual cash value amount of damage to a main property in whole dollars.

data_fields.name: buildingDeductibleCode
data_fields.title: Building Deductible Code
data_fields.description: The total deductible amount in dollars for buildings, both main and appurtenant, that can be applied against a loss.

codes.H: $200 - Used only in Group Flood Insurance Policies

data_fields.name: netBuildingPaymentAmount
data_fields.title: Net Building Payment Amount
data_fields.description: Net building payment amount made to insured in dollars

data_fields.name: buildingPropertyValue
data_fields.title: Building Property Value
data_fields.description: The actual cash value of the main building in whole dollars as estimated by an adjuster

data_fields.name: causeOfDamage
data_fields.title: Cause of Damage Code
data_fields.description: Indicates the method by which the insured's property and contents were damaged.

codes.9: Earth movement, landslide, land subsidence, sinkholes, etc.
codes.B: Expedited claim handling process without site inspection
codes.C: Expedited claim handling process follow-up site inspection
codes.D: Expedited claim handling process by Adjusting Process Pilot Program (Remote Adjustment)

data_fields.name: condominiumCoverageTypeCode
data_fields.title: Condominium Coverage Type Code
data_fields.description: Indicates what type of coverage the building has.

codes.U: Individual Condominium Unit insured by a unit owner or by an association

data_fields.name: contentsDamageAmount
data_fields.title: Contents Damage Amount
data_fields.description: The actual cash value amount of damage to contents in whole dollars

data_fields.name: contentsDeductibleCode
data_fields.title: Contents Deductible Code
data_fields.description: The total deductible amount in dollars for contents in both main and apartment structures that can be applied against the loss.

codes.H: $200 - Used only in Group Flood Insurance Policies

data_fields.name: netContentsPaymentAmount
data_fields.title: Net Contents Payment Amount
data_fields.description: Net contents payment amount made to insured in dollars

data_fields.name: contentsPropertyValue
data_fields.title: Contents Property Value
data_fields.description: The actual cash value of the contents in whole dollars as estimated by an adjuster

data_fields.name: disasterAssistanceCoverageRequired
data_fields.title: Disaster Assistance Coverage Required Code
data_fields.description: Indicates which federal agency has required the purchase of flood insurance as a requirement for disaster assistance.

data_fields.name: eventDesignationNumber
data_fields.title: Event Designation Number (EDN)
data_fields.description: The Event Designation Number (EDN) is a unique identifier established for a catastrophe flood event. NOTE: EDN has replaced FICO as the new event tracking designation. Prior to June 2020 flood events were assigned FICO number designations; after June 2020, flood events are assigned EDN number designations. A public bulletin will designate the EDN number assignments by state with corresponding dates of loss. Example: 2 letter state abbreviation (TX), 2-digit event designator (02) and 2-digit year (20). Full example would be TX0220.

data_fields.name: ficoNumber
data_fields.title: Flood Insurance Claims Office (FICO) Number
data_fields.description: Number assigned at the time of a significant flooding event to uniquely identify each affected state. A public bulletin will designate the FICO number assignments by state with corresponding dates of loss. Note: Flood Insurance Claims Office (FICO) is an NFIP claims processing office set up in a catastrophe area when a sufficient number of flood claims result from a single event. EDN has replaced FICO as the new event tracking designation. Prior to June 2020 flood events were assigned FICO number designations; after June 2020, flood events are assigned EDN number designations. A public bulletin will designate the EDN number assignments by state with corresponding dates of loss. Example: 2 letter state abbreviation (TX), 2-digit event designator (02) and 2-digit year (20). Full example would be TX0220.

data_fields.name: floodCharacteristicsIndicator
data_fields.title: Flood Characteristics Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates characteristics of the flood waters.

data_fields.name: floodWaterDuration
data_fields.title: Flood Water Duration
data_fields.description: Number of hours flood water remained in the insured building

data_fields.name: floodproofedIndicator
data_fields.title: Floodproofed Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates if the insured structure is floodproofed. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. NOTE: Floodproofing is any combination of structural and non-structural additions, changes, or adjustments to structures which reduce or eliminate flood damage to a property. Floodproofing may be an alternative to elevating a building to or above the BFE; however, the NFIP requires a Floodproofing Certificate prior to considering floodproofing mitigation measures in rating a structure.

data_fields.name: floodEvent
data_fields.title: Flood Event
data_fields.description: Name given to a flooding catastrophe

data_fields.name: iccCoverage
data_fields.title: Increased Cost of Compliance (ICC) Coverage
data_fields.description: Amount of Increased Cost of Compliance (ICC) coverage for building in whole dollars. NOTE: ICC coverage is the coverage for expenses that a property owner must incur, above and beyond the cost to repair the physical damage the building actually sustained from a flooding event, to comply with mitigation requirements of state or local floodplain management ordinances or laws. Acceptable mitigation measures are elevation, floodproofing, relocation, demolition, or any combination thereof

data_fields.name: netIccPaymentAmount
data_fields.title: Net Increased Cost of Compliance (ICC) Payment Amount
data_fields.description: Net Increased Cost of Compliance (ICC) payment amount made to insured in dollars.

data_fields.name: nfipRatedCommunityNumber
data_fields.title: Rated NFIP Community Number
data_fields.description: A six-digit designation identifying the rated NFIP community. The first two numbers are the state code. The next four are the FEMA-assigned community number. An alphabetical suffix is added to a community number to identify revisions in the FIRM for that community

data_fields.name: nfipCommunityNumberCurrent
data_fields.title: Current NFIP Community Number
data_fields.description: A six-digit designation identifying the current NFIP community. The first two numbers are the state code. The next four are the FEMA-assigned community number. An alphabetical suffix is added to a community number to identify revisions in the FIRM for that community

data_fields.name: nfipCommunityName
data_fields.title: Rated NFIP Community Name
data_fields.description: A local political entity that has the authority to adopt and enforce floodplain ordinances for the area under its jurisdiction.

data_fields.name: nonPaymentReasonContents
data_fields.title: Contents Non-Payment Reason
data_fields.description: Reason why a claim was not paid for the contents of a property.

codes.01: Claim denied that was less than deductible
codes.15: Not insured, damage before inception of policy
codes.17: Type of erosion not included in definition of flood or flooding
codes.19: Type of mudflow not included in definition of flood or flooding

data_fields.name: nonPaymentReasonBuilding
data_fields.title: Building Non-Payment Reason
data_fields.description: Reason why a claim was not paid for a property structure.

codes.01: Claim denied that was less than deductible
codes.15: Not insured, damage before inception of policy
codes.17: Type of erosion not included in definition of flood or flooding
codes.19: Type of mudflow not included in definition of flood or flooding

data_fields.name: numberOfUnits
data_fields.title: Number of Units
data_fields.description: The number of residential and nonresidential units covered by the Condominium Master Policy

data_fields.name: buildingReplacementCost
data_fields.title: Building Replacement Cost
data_fields.description: Estimated cost in whole dollars to replace the building as reported by the insurer. NOTE : Replacement cost is not market value, and it does not include the cost of the land or contents. It is strictly the estimated cost to reconstruct the building

data_fields.name: contentsReplacementCost
data_fields.title: Contents Replacement Cost
data_fields.description: Estimated cost in whole dollars to replace the contents as reported by the insurer. NOTE : Replacement cost is not market value, and it does not include the cost of the land or building. It is strictly the estimated cost to replace the contents.

data_fields.name: replacementCostBasis
data_fields.title: Replacement Cost Basis
data_fields.description: This indicates whether the building claim was settled on a replacement cost basis.

data_fields.name: stateOwnedIndicator
data_fields.title: State-Owned Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates whether insured property is state owned. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. NOTE: State owned property is land or other assets that are legally owned by the state

data_fields.name: waterDepth
data_fields.title: Water Depth
data_fields.description: Depth of flood water in inches. Note: there are instances where measurements were provided in feet.

data_fields.name: floodZoneCurrent
data_fields.title: Current Flood Zone
data_fields.description: Flood zone derived from the Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM) where the insured property is currently located.

codes.A: Special Flood with no Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.AE: Special Flood with Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.X: Moderate Flood from primary water source. Pockets of areas subject to drainage problems
codes.B: Moderate Flood from primary water source. Pockets of areas subject to drainage problems
codes.C: Minimal Flood from primary water source. Pockets of areas subject to drainage problems
codes.V: Velocity Flood with no Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.VE: Velocity Flood with Base Flood Elevation on FIRM
codes.AR: A Special Flood Hazard Area that results from the decertification of a previously accredited flood protection system that is determined to be in the process of being restored to provide base flood protection
codes.AR/AE: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/A1-A30: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/AH: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/AO: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone
codes.AR/A: Areas subject to flooding from failure of the flood protection system (Zone AR) which also overlap an existing Special Flood Hazard Area as a dual zone

data_fields.name: buildingDescriptionCode
data_fields.title: Building Description Code
data_fields.description: Indicates the description of the use of the insured building.

data_fields.name: rentalPropertyIndicator
data_fields.title: Rental Property Indicator
data_fields.description: Indicates if the property is a rental property. Yes is indicated with either a 'true' or '1'. No is indicated with either a 'false' or '0'. NOTE: A rental property is a property from which the owner receives payment from the occupant(s), known as tenants, in return for occupying or using the property. Rental properties may be either residential or commercial

data_fields.name: state
data_fields.title: State
data_fields.description: The two-character alpha abbreviation of the state in which the insured property is located

data_fields.name: reportedCity
data_fields.title: Reported City
data_fields.description: This is the city of the insured property as reported to us by our Write Your Own (WYO) partners

data_fields.name: reportedZipCode
data_fields.title: Reported Zip Code
data_fields.description: 5-digit Postal Zip Code of the insured property as reported by WYO partners

data_fields.name: countyCode
data_fields.title: County Code
data_fields.description: FIPS code uniquely identifying the primary County (e.g., 011 represents Broward County) associated with the project. Note, the County Code field may not reflect the individual county the property is located as projects can be associated with more than one county

data_fields.name: censusTract
data_fields.title: Census Tract
data_fields.description: U.S. Census Bureau defined census tracts; statistical subdivisions of a county or equivalent entity that are updated prior to each decennial census. The NFIP relies on our geocoding service to assign 11-digit census tract codes

data_fields.name: censusBlockGroupFips
data_fields.title: Census Block Group FIPS
data_fields.description: The first digit of the census block number identifies the block group. Block numbers beginning with a zero (in Block Group 0) are associated with water-only areas. Typically, Block Groups have a population of 600 to 3,000 people.

data_fields.name: latitude
data_fields.title: Latitude
data_fields.description: Approximate latitude of the insured building (to 1 decimal place). This represents the approximate location of the insured property. The precision has been lessened to ensure individual privacy. This may result in a point location that exists in an incorrect county or state. Use the state and county fields for record aggregation for these dimensions

data_fields.name: longitude
data_fields.title: Longitude
data_fields.description: Approximate longitude of the insured building (to 1 decimal place). This represents the approximate location of the insured property. The precision has been lessened to ensure individual privacy. This may result in a point location that exists in an incorrect county or state. Use the state and county fields for record aggregation for these dimensions

data_fields.name: id
data_fields.title: ID
data_fields.description: Unique ID assigned to the record
